intro: Eriogonella spinosa, commonly known as the spiny eriogonoid, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, spiny bracts and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as slopes and grasslands. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. Eriogonella spinosa plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small animals.
